reviews.text: the worst game Platinum has ever made but one of the worst live service titles of any kind
the combat never evolves beyond its initial state
the jump doesn’t seem to work properly, with a weird input lag
the graphics underneath are under-detailed and blandly designed like a FromSoftware game with all the imagination drained out
the game is riddled with microtransactions and a premium battle pass
the story is told in very broad strokes
four weapons in play at once is an interesting idea
the game is £60 but with microtransactions for better gear
enemies spawn without warning and bosses have tedious health bars
the art style combines Mesopotamian setting with Renaissance painting filter
repetitive gameplay loop of arenas and linear corridors
loot system uninteresting with microtransactions for better gear
spectral weapons float weirdly and look silly
four-player co-op but can’t change loadout mid-mission
the game is a live service failure with poor retention
combat is dull and mechanical, feeling like a chore
bosses are tedious to defeat due to high health without challenge
the game’s price is £59.99 but requires real money for better gear
the art style’s Renaissance filter clashes with the setting
the game’s repetitive arena-based progression
